Paper.Title: ATNS USED AS A PROCEDURAL DIALOG MODEL

Section.S: An attempt has been made to use an Augmented Transition Network as a procedural dialog model.
The development of such a model appears to be important in several respects:
as a device to represent and to use different dialog schemata proposed in empirical conversation analysis;
as a device to represent and to use models of verbal interaction;
as a device combining knowledge about dialog schemata and about verbal interaction with knowledge about task-oriented and goal-directed dialogs.
A standard ATN should be further developed in order to account for the verbal interactions of task-oriented dialogs.
